myExercises.title: My Exercises
myExercises.activeProgramsDescription: Your current exercise programs based on pain assessments
myExercises.noEndedPrograms: You don't have any ended programs yet.

exercisePlanPage.generalDescription: Don't have time for individual programs? Here you'll find a personalized program with the most important exercises from your programs. Follow the instructions and stop exercising if you feel pain.
exercisePlanPage.title: Exercise Plan

exercisePlan.suitableQuestion: Is this exercise suitable for you?
exercisePlan.painQuestion: 1. Does the exercise cause you pain?
exercisePlan.changeQuestion: 2. Do you want to change this exercise?
exercisePlan.changeRequestInfo: After submitting this request, we will contact you regarding a suitable exercise replacement.

importantNotice.title: Important Notice
importantNotice.text: These exercises are recommended based on your assessment. If you experience severe pain or discomfort, consult a healthcare professional.

generalProgram.title: General Program
generalProgram.description: Don't have time for individual programs? Here you'll find a personalized program with the most important exercises from your programs. Follow the instructions and stop exercising if you feel pain.

frozenShoulderPhase1.title: Frozen Shoulder - Phase 1: Pain Relief and Gentle Mobility
frozenShoulderPhase1.description: Initial phase focusing on pain management and gentle range of motion exercises. Perform these exercises 2-3 times daily during the acute phase.

pendulumExercises.title: Pendulum Exercises
pendulumExercises.description: Gentle swinging movements to maintain shoulder mobility without forcing movement. Perform 10-15 swings in each direction, 2-3 times daily.

isometricExternalRotation.title: Isometric External Rotation
isometricExternalRotation.description: Gentle strengthening without movement to maintain muscle tone. Hold for 5-10 seconds, repeat 10 times, 2-3 times daily.

rotatorCuffRelease.title: Rotator Cuff Self-Massage
rotatorCuffRelease.description: Gentle self-massage techniques to reduce muscle tension and improve circulation. Perform for 5-10 minutes daily.

shoulderHeating.title: Shoulder Warming Exercises
shoulderHeating.description: Gentle warming movements to prepare the shoulder for other exercises and reduce stiffness. Perform before other exercises.

frozenShoulderPhase2.title: Frozen Shoulder - Phase 2: Progressive Strengthening
frozenShoulderPhase2.description: Progressive strengthening phase when pain begins to subside. Focus on rebuilding shoulder strength and stability.

isometricShoulderPresses.title: Isometric Shoulder Presses
isometricShoulderPresses.description: Progressive strengthening exercises to rebuild shoulder muscle strength. Hold for 10-15 seconds, repeat 10-15 times.

wallPushUps.title: Wall Push-Ups
wallPushUps.description: Modified push-ups against the wall to strengthen shoulder and chest muscles safely. Start with 10 repetitions, progress gradually.

interscapularStrengthening.title: Upper Back and Shoulder Blade Strengthening
interscapularStrengthening.description: Strengthening exercises for the muscles between shoulder blades to improve posture and shoulder stability. Perform 10-15 repetitions.

subacromialImpingement.title: Subacromial Impingement Syndrome - Pain Relief and Mobility
subacromialImpingement.description: Exercises designed to reduce impingement and improve shoulder mechanics. Focus on creating space in the shoulder joint.

interscapularStrengthening.title: Shoulder Blade Strengthening
interscapularStrengthening.description: Strengthening the muscles that pull shoulder blades together to improve shoulder alignment and reduce impingement.

gentlePendulum.title: Gentle Pendulum Swings
gentlePendulum.description: Light pendulum movements to maintain mobility without aggravating impingement. Keep movements small and pain-free.

preExerciseHeating.title: Pre-Exercise Warming
preExerciseHeating.description: Warming exercises to prepare the shoulder joint before performing other therapeutic exercises.

rotatorCuffTear.title: Rotator Cuff Tear - Conservative Management
rotatorCuffTear.description: Conservative treatment focusing on pain management and maintaining available range of motion.

isometricStrengthening.title: Isometric Strengthening
isometricStrengthening.description: Gentle strengthening without movement to avoid further damage while maintaining muscle tone.

rotatorCuffMassage.title: Rotator Cuff Massage
rotatorCuffMassage.description: Self-massage techniques to improve circulation and reduce muscle tension around the rotator cuff.

defaultNociceptive.title: General Shoulder Pain Management
defaultNociceptive.description: General exercises for shoulder pain when specific diagnosis is unclear. Focus on basic mobility and gentle strengthening.

basicMobility.title: Basic Shoulder Mobility
basicMobility.description: Fundamental exercises to maintain or restore basic shoulder range of motion.

basicStrengthening.title: Basic Shoulder Strengthening
basicStrengthening.description: Simple strengthening exercises suitable for most shoulder conditions.
